task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 341°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building height accurately, I need to see the roofline and the base in one view, so I will tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading is now 0° instead of ~341°, so I should rotate left about 19° to re-center the target building while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roof.
I need a clear view of both the building base and roofline to estimate height, so I will tilt up again while staying on the correct heading.
The view keeps snapping to 0° when pitching up, so I'll estimate from the current perspective by capturing more of the facade and roof with a slight downward correction after a small yaw toward 341°.
With the building centered and slightly down-tilted, I can approximate its height by counting visible stories and using ~3.2 m per story plus roof structure.
